p:
In order to check if the heterologous expression of the AAF subunits also resulted in the expected cell surface structures of host strain EAEC 55989 agg3
− , we subjected the bacteria to EM analysis. As shown in Figure 3, thin surface structures resembling the previously described fimbriae of the corresponding wild type cells could be detected when EAEC strain 55989 agg3
− was heterologously expressing AAF/I, III, IV, and V, but not when containing the empty plasmid (NC). Irrespective of the plasmid, strain 55989 agg3
− was expressing flagella that were substantially longer and thicker than the fimbriae, which were readily distinguishable from the flagella, as expected ( Figure 3).
